critique: The executive order seems to be a formal document with the purpose of outlining the conditions under which certain employees of the Office of Management and Budget can have their appointments converted to career or career-conditional appointments. It doesn't seem designed to evoke strong emotions. However, it could bring a sense of joy to those employees who meet the criteria for conversion, and perhaps some sadness or fear to those who don't. Surprise and disgust are unlikely to be relevant emotions here. The intensity of any emotion is likely to be low, given the bureaucratic nature of the document.
